intro: Hosta campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped hosta, is a perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically variegated with white or yellow margins. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, fragrant flowers in shades of blue or lavender during the summer months. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Hosta campanulata is a popular ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
